postcontent:
I have a WWII bring back ERMA Deutfches Sportmodell, this gun has been in my family since it was brought back from WWII and is in good condition.  The stock is in good condition and as you can see from the pics there is a piece of black electrical tape wrapped around it.  I removed it (and replaced it) and there is no damage or cracks to the stock and can only imagine that it was put there grip possibly.  The bolt barrel and bluing are all good and fully functional.  Leather strap is a little dry but in very good shape also.

As you can see there are numbers stamped into the stock and as I was told these are rack numbers for storage.  These guns were designed by Mauser as a training rifle for the German/Nazi military and are meant to simulate the handling of the Mauser K98 but disguised as sporting rifles.

Post WWI Germany was prohibited from the manufacture of arms and only permitted to produce small caliber arms for sporting purposes thus these guns have Sportmodell on them.

The serial # is 5508 and has Kal 22 Lang (22 long) FURBUCHSEN as well as GmbH-Abt Gewehrfabrik-ERFURT written on the barrel.  

The gun as been appraised at between $700-800!
